org.flexiblepower.ral.ext

Class AbstractResourceManager<RS extends ResourceState,RCP extends ResourceControlParameters>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.flexiblepower.ral.ext.AbstractResourceManager<RS,RCP>
  • Type Parameters:
    RS - The type of the ResourceState
    RCP - The type of the ResourceControlParameters
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.flexiblepower.messaging.Endpoint, ResourceManager

    public abstract class AbstractResourceManager<RS extends ResourceState,RCP extends ResourceControlParameters>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ResourceManager
    Gives a basic implementation for a ResourceManager which does simple translation, possible while keeping state information.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractResourceManager

        protected AbstractResourceManager()

    • Method Detail

      • unconnectedStateUpdate

        protected void unconnectedStateUpdate(RS state)
        This method is called when a state update from the driver has been received, but this manager is not connected. The default implementation logs a info message to remind that it is not connected.
        Parameters:
        state - The state of the driver

      • startRegistration

        protected abstract java.util.List<? extends ResourceMessage> startRegistration(RS state)
        This method is called when the first state has been received from the driver and a registration is needed. This method should return a list of ResourceMessages that should at least contain a registration message.
        Parameters:
        state - The state of the driver
        Returns:
        A list of ResourceMessages that will be sent to the controller.

      • updatedState

        protected abstract java.util.List<? extends ResourceMessage> updatedState(RS state)
        This method is called when the state is updated and the startRegistration(ResourceState) has already been called previously.
        Parameters:
        state - The state of the driver
        Returns:
        A list of ResourceMessages that will be sent to the controller.

      • receivedAllocation

        protected abstract RCP receivedAllocation(ResourceMessage message)
        This method is called when a message has been received from the controller. This will generally be an Allocation object, but could also be of another type, depending on the used message type.
        Parameters:
        message - The received message
        Returns:
        The ResourceControlParameters that should be sent to the driver.

      • createRevokeMessage

        protected abstract ControlSpaceRevoke createRevokeMessage()
        This method is called when a revoke message is needed (e.g. when the driver has disconnected).
        Returns:
        The ControlSpaceRevoke that will be sent to the controller.

      • onConnect

        public org.flexiblepower.messaging.MessageHandler onConnect(org.flexiblepower.messaging.Connection connection)
        Specified by:
        onConnect in interface org.flexiblepower.messaging.Endpoint

      • isConnectedWithResourceController

        protected boolean isConnectedWithResourceController()
        Indicate if this ResourceManager is currently connected to a ControllerManager.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if this ResourceManager is currently connected to a ControllerManager

      • isConnectedWithResourceDriver

        protected boolean isConnectedWithResourceDriver()
        Indicate if this ResourceManager is currently connected to a ResourceDriver.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if this ResourceManager is currently connected to a ResourceDriver

      • allocationStatusUpdate

        protected void allocationStatusUpdate(AllocationStatusUpdate allocationStatusUpdate)
        Send status update to attached controller.
        Parameters:
        allocationStatusUpdate - The AllocationStatusUpdate that is to be sent to the controller.

      • sendControlParameters

        protected void sendControlParameters(ResourceControlParameters controlParameters)
        Send control parameters to attached driver.
        Parameters:
        controlParameters - The parameters that have to be sent to the driver
